info: It's commonly used for repairing objects, correcting mistakes, or fixing problems.
You might see this in a Japanese class telling you to correct your mistakes.

example_sentences.japanese: 答えを見て、赤ペンで直して次の日のクラスで出す。
example_sentences.english: Look at the answers, correct them with a red pen, and turn them in for the next day's class.

mnemonics: Contains 糸 (thread)
Contains 氵 (water drops)
Notice 心 (heart) radical at the bottom
info: Often used with the particle に
Basic structure: [Source of emotion] に 感動する "[Subject] is moved by [source of emotion]"

example_sentences.japanese: 美しい景色に感動しました。
example_sentences.english: I was moved by the beautiful scenery.

mnemonics: The kanji looks like a roof (宀) over a small figure - protecting something under a roof
info: Can be used for physical protection (e.g., 子供を守る - protect a child)
Also used for abstract concepts (e.g., 約束を守る - keep a promise)
Used with rules/laws (e.g., 規則を守る - follow rules)
Related: お守り (おまもり) - protective charm/amulet

example_sentences.japanese: 秘密を守ってください。
example_sentences.english: Please keep the secret.

info: おくる can be written in either hiragana or kanji
Structure: 人(に)物(が)似合う - The thing (が) suits the person (に)

mnemonics: When you consult with someone, you ask them questions. When you learn something new, you say "そうか". That sounds a bit like そうだん, right?
Han Solo says, "Chewie, watch out!"

example_sentences.japanese: 先生は学生にうるさいと注意しました。
example_sentences.english: The teacher warned the students that they were being noisy.

example_sentences.japanese: 道路で注意してください。
example_sentences.english: Please be careful on the road.

example_sentences.japanese: 熊に注意してください。
example_sentences.english: Be careful of bears.

info: Can also be used with 荷物を下ろす (to unload luggage)

example_sentences.japanese: お金を下ろす
example_sentences.english: To withdraw money (literally, unloading money)

info: Action focused
Refers to the act of searching for something. It implies that the object or information you are looking for has not yet been found.
見つける -> to find X item (item focused)
見つける focuses on the result of the search, indicating that the object is known

example_sentences.japanese: 新しい仕事を探している
example_sentences.english: I'm looking for a new job

info: Structure: 人をopportunityに誘う

example_sentences.japanese: 大学で知り合った友達を家に誘う
example_sentences.english: Invite a friend you met at university over to your house

info: Structure: Aさんは/がBさんと付き合っている -> Aさん and Bさん are dating (refers to a committed relationship)
デートする is used for individual dating events, whether or not the people involved are in a serious relationship

example_sentences.japanese: 分からない言葉は辞書で調べます。
example_sentences.english: I look up words I don't understand in the dictionary.

mnemonics: Contains 見 - meaning 'to see'
予 (よ) means 'beforehand,' 約 (やく) means 'promise' (same as in 約束)
参: Consists of the radicals 人 (person) + 大 (big) + 小 (small). Think of 'all kinds of people, big and small, participating together.'
加: The hiragana か and katakana カ were derived from this kanji
To see how other hiragana were derived, check out https://www.reddit.com/r/LearnJapanese/comments/9vwxhn/hiragana_chart_showing_the_kanji_they_came_from/
業 is the same kanji as in 授業 (じゅぎょう; class)
info: You must use ～を instead of ～から when describing where you're graduating from
Can be used with 式 (しき) to form 卒業式 (graduation ceremony)

mnemonics: 起 (o) means 'wake up', こす (kosu) sounds like 'coax' - coaxing someone to wake up
info: Transitive verb (V.T.)
Compare with intransitive verb (V.I.) 起きる (to wake up)

example_sentences.japanese: 朝、弟を起こします。
example_sentences.english: I wake up my younger brother in the morning.

mnemonics: 笑 (wara) looks like a person laughing with their mouth open
info: Different types of laughter:
アハハと笑う (to laugh 'ahaha')
ガハハと笑う (to burst into laughter)
ウフフと笑う (to giggle)
エヘヘと笑う (embarrassed grin)
ニコニコ笑う (to smile)
ニコッと笑う (to grin)
クスッと笑う (to chuckle)

example_sentences.japanese: 面白い話を聞いて、みんなが笑いました。
example_sentences.english: Everyone laughed after hearing the funny story.

mnemonics: 落ち (ochi) means 'fall', 込む (komu) means 'go into' - falling into a low mood
info: 落ち込む means 'to GET depressed'
落ち込んでいる means 'to be depressed' (ongoing state)

example_sentences.japanese: 試験に失敗して、落ち込んでいます。
example_sentences.english: I'm feeling depressed because I failed the exam.

mnemonics: 困 (koma) looks like a box (囗) with a tree (木) inside - being trapped in a difficult situation

example_sentences.japanese: お金がなくて困っています。
example_sentences.english: I'm having difficulty because I don't have money.

mnemonics: 直 (nao) means 'straight/direct' - making something right again
info: Common uses: 宿題を直す (to correct homework), 家具を直す (to fix furniture)

example_sentences.japanese: 先生が宿題の間違いを直してくれました。
example_sentences.english: The teacher corrected the mistakes in my homework.

mnemonics: 訳 (yaku) means 'translate/meaning', す (su) is a verb ending
info: Kanji breakdown: 言 (say) + 尺 (measure) - measuring what is said in another language

example_sentences.japanese: この文章を日本語から英語に訳しました。
example_sentences.english: I translated this text from Japanese to English.

mnemonics: 貸 (ka) has the money radical (貝), implying lending money or valuables
info: Opposite: 借りる (to borrow)

example_sentences.japanese: 友達に本を貸しました。
example_sentences.english: I lent a book to my friend.

mnemonics: 集 (atsu) means 'gather', める (meru) is a verb ending
info: Transitive verb (V.T.)
Related: 集まる (V.I., to gather)

example_sentences.japanese: 切手を集めています。
example_sentences.english: I'm collecting stamps.

example_sentences.japanese: １０時に集まってください。
example_sentences.english: Please gather at 10 o'clock.

example_sentences.japanese: 私は猫が大好きで、猫のグッズを集めています。
example_sentences.english: I love cats and collect cat goods.

example_sentences.japanese: 今朝、朝寝坊して、遅刻しました。
example_sentences.english: I overslept this morning and was late.

mnemonics: 案内 (annai) means 'guidance', する (suru) makes it a verb
info: Usage: 人にPlaceを案内する (to show a place to someone)

example_sentences.japanese: 友達に町を案内しました。
example_sentences.english: I showed my friend around town.

mnemonics: Kanji breakdown: 説 (explain) + 明 (bright, clear)
info: Common mistake: ❌️説明をあげる (to give explanation) - simply use 説明した

example_sentences.japanese: 先生が問題を説明しました。
example_sentences.english: The teacher explained the problem.

furigana: 迎[むか]えに 来[く]る
mnemonics: 迎え (mukae) means 'to meet/greet', 来る (kuru) means 'to come'
info: Opposite of 迎えに行く (to go to pick up)

example_sentences.japanese: 母が学校に私を迎えに来ました。
example_sentences.english: My mother came to school to pick me up.

mnemonics: 失(しつ) means 'lose' and 礼(れい) means 'manners' - when you excuse yourself, you're temporarily 'losing manners' by interrupting or leaving
info: Often used when leaving a room or ending a conversation
Can be more polite as 失礼します (shitsurei shimasu)
Also used to apologize for being rude

example_sentences.japanese: ちょっと失礼します。
example_sentences.english: Excuse me for a moment.

info: Related word: 選挙(せんきょ) meaning election
Used in pairs with wearing verbs:
シャツを着る、脱ぐ (for shirts)
ブーツをはく、ブーツを脱ぐ (for boots)
Used to describe traffic: (道が）混んでいる (there is traffic)

example_sentences.japanese: 道が混んでいる
example_sentences.english: There is traffic

example_sentences.japanese: 時間が足りない
example_sentences.english: There isn't enough time

mnemonics: 化粧 from 化粧品

furigana: 就職[しゅうしょく]する
info: Similar expressions:
〜で働く (to work at)
〜に務める (to work for/serve at)

mnemonics: The 婚 character is the same as in 結婚 (marriage)

info: Intransitive verb (v.i.)
Transitive pair: 消す(けす)

example_sentences.japanese: このコンピューター、消しても消えない〜！！困ったなあ。壊れちゃったのかな。
example_sentences.english: This computer won't turn off even when I try to shut it down! What a problem. I wonder if it's broken.

info: Intransitive pair of 壊す
Intransitive verb (v.i.)
Transitive pair: 開ける(あける)
Used with が particle

mnemonics: Both 開 and 閉 characters contain 門 (gate)
info: Intransitive verb (v.i.)
Transitive pair: 閉める(しめる)

mnemonics: Contains the radical 言 (word)
Contains the radical 手 (hand)
info: Basic physical action of pushing/pressing
Used for buttons, doorbells, keypads
Can be combined with various particles:
- を押す: direct pushing of an object
- に押す: pushing against something

example_sentences.japanese: エレベーターのボタンを押してください。
example_sentences.english: Please press the elevator button.

info: Transitive pair of 落ちる

mnemonics: Same 転 as in 自転車 meaning 'to roll'

info: Common phrase: (〜さんのおかげで)助かりました
Note: Used for thanking outsiders, not family/superiors
Transitive pair: 助ける
Related noun: 頼み (request, favor)
Transitive pair of 汚れる
Related: 汚い(きたない)

mnemonics: Uses same 注 as in 注意する
info: Can be used both for online shopping and in-store orders
Honorific usage depends on context
Intransitive verb
